summary:
Victoria Falls is an impressive waterfall located on the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe in Africa. It's one of the widest waterfalls globally, stretching over 1700 meters. The area is home to various plants and animals.

The falls have a rich history, known to locals for centuries, but Scottish explorer David Livingstone named them after Queen Victoria in 1855. Today, it's a popular tourist attraction with parks and facilities in both countries. However, climate change might impact the falls' future due to changing rainfall patterns.
title: Victoria Falls
